listing_jobDesc:
Salary
£41,000 - £56,000
Location
Remote first with an office available in Central London and regular team meetings in the office
Reporting to
Andy Dudfield
Employment Type
Permanent
We are happy to talk about flexible working, [including part time].
Application Closing Date
08/08/2022
Introduction to the role
Our work makes a difference. Millions of people use our fact checking each year, including most of the major internet companies. We get powerful people and institutions to correct the record, including politicians and the national media.

The scale of the challenge we are facing is huge. Every day we identify nearly 100,000 things to potentially fact check and we are looking to recruit a Data Scientist to help us identify the most important of these, to help build tools to make the process of fact checking faster and to ensure that we get the very most out of every fact check we publish.
Full Fact has placed a significant focus on the use of technology to address bad information for a number of years. You will be the third data scientist to join us and the 9th person in our wider technical team.

You will be joining as we start to make the tools we have made so far available to other fact checkers around the world and your role will be specifically looking to use ML and NLP techniques to help address the needs of fact checkers around the globe.


Working at Full Fact is more than just building tools. We are looking for people who want to improve the news and politics ecosystems and who have thought deeply about the nuance and complexity that exists within the space. We are also looking for people who are willing to make a real commitment to impartiality and to safeguarding that impartiality.

If you are interested in applying but not sure you have all the skills, please do apply. We are open both to supporting learning on the job and to rearranging tasks within the team to suit the skillsets of the best applicant
Job Definition
Full Fact uses NLP and ML to power tools built to aid fact checkers’ analysis of news and other information. This helps give fact-checkers more time to focus on research, analysis, and writing articles that contextualise the news and help all of us make more informed decisions.
This Data Scientist role is a new addition to our team and aims to expand our ability to process a wide range of information and to identify statements that might need to be reviewed and to look for patterns in online and broadcast media information that may help us prioritise the topics that we check, find repeats of things we have previously fact checked and ensure that every part of our AI pipeline works in multiple spoken languages

Outcomes

Developing systems and techniques to help us build out different stages of our automated fact checking system, including:

Identifying sightings of previously checked claims at real-time speed

Spotting candidate claims across a broad range of media

Checking candidate claims against known datasets

Helping to integrate the technologies you build into products that will have an immediate use, for both fact checkers and journalists

Measuring and improving the quality of the system

Using NLP, ML, and data automation to push the boundaries of what's possible

What we are looking for from you
Political impartiality and sensitivity:
You are committed to the political neutrality of our work and have a good understanding of impartiality (please see the rules on our website).
Understanding of public debate in the UK and sensitivity to the political context we work in.
Job skills/competencies

You have a good understanding of Natural Language Processing and used this in an applicable context

You have a good awareness of Machine Learning techniques

You are comfortable doing rapid prototyping and breaking down large problems into solvable ones

Ideally you've done a research project in NLP, Knowledge Extraction, Information Retrieval or ML at MSc or PhD level and/or have considerable experience in an applicable industry.
You’ll be building systems, so you should be a strong engineer too. We currently use Python for this although if you are happy to learn it doesn’t matter which languages you’ve used previously

Personal skills/competencies

You are comfortable working in an Agile way

You are an excellent communicator and can explain the concepts behind your work to a non technical audience.

You should be excited about pushing forward the state of the art for automated fact checking

What we offer
Starting salary of £41,000 - £56,000 depending on experience.
Workplace Pension
Generous holidays

25 days holiday plus bank holidays.
In addition, we close the office for a period between Christmas and New Year.
Day off for moving home.

Comfortable, centrally located London office with good transport links.
Employee Assistance Programme.
How to apply
Upload your CV and cover letter using the link below by 10am on Monday [08/08/22]
Our recruitment platform will remove identifying details such as email addresses to allow us to sift applications anonymously
Before applying, please read the requirements we place on staff to protect Full Fact’s independence and non-partisanship. https://fullfact.org/jobs/#standards
How the application process will work
We want to see you at your best to understand your strengths and the contribution you could make at Full Fact with strong support, including for your learning and development. We also want to make sure that we use your time well during this process and don’t ask for more from you than we need to. We will make any reasonable adjustments we need to make to this process to help ensure you can perform at your best. For more information about this before applying, please contact jobs@fullfact.org.
The interview panel will be Will Moy, our CEO, Kate Wilkinson (Senior Product Manager) and Andy Dudfield (Head of Automated Fact Checking). You will also meet with David Corney, our Data Scientist for an additional technical task.
The process starts off with an anonymised covering letter and CV. This will be read by at least two people to produce a shortlist for interview.
The first round interviews will be a phone (not video) interview, lasting no more than half an hour, at a time that’s convenient for you. We will record it so at least two people can review each interview to decide who we invite back for the second round. The recordings will be deleted at the end of the process.
The second round will include a structured interview and a technical presentation of a task which assumes no prior knowledge. The task can be completed prior to the interview, at a time that most suits you.
The final interview will be with the full panel by video and last no more than an hour. We’ll tell you everything you need to know to prepare, including anything we’d recommend reading in advance. Salary
£41,000 - £56,000
Location
Remote first with an office available in Central London and regular team meetings in the office
Reporting to
Andy Dudfield
Employment Type
Permanent
We are happy to talk about flexible working, [including part time].
Application Closing Date
08/08/2022

Comfortable, centrally located London office with good transport links.

Junior Data Scientist
Data Science & Advanced Analytics in Business Operations
You would become part of a growing internal data science team dealing with huge variety of data across many businesses within the company. You would be involved in enterprise-level analytics and machine learning projects. Participate in the development and execution of complex statistical, econometric, and machine learning analysis especially in Operational Effectiveness. Collaborate with various teams across the company from data science, consulting to marketing, sales and finance solving complex business questions.

If you are a talented, detail-oriented Data Scientists with a solid software development foundation and a commitment to deliver the best possible technology solutions, then we want to hear from you!

Your typical activities will include:
Analyse, organise and combine raw data from a variety of sources
Engineering data pipelines, as well as deriving insights and building models from the data
Map processes, identify data gaps and opportunities for improvement via modelling.
Collaborate with other data scientists, analysts, and business owners within IQVIA on multiple projects to deliver high quality data products, analysis and models
Develop data visualisations and interactive dashboards
Produce reports and communicate your findings to stakeholders and the team
Conduct research from which you will develop prototypes and proof of concepts
Research current and emerging industry tools and techniques, and share these findings with colleagues
Drive curiosity and innovation
Facilitate cross-team knowledge sharing
Your Qualifications:
Advanced degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Economics/Econometrics, Computer Science, or related field
Knowledge of Python, SQL, Spark
Solid understanding of linear algebra, probability, and statistics, as well as extensive practical use of mathematical, statistical, machine learning and deep learning techniques
Familiarity with data science and machine learning and deep learning methods and frameworks
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (PowerBi, Tableau etc.)
Experience applying Machine Learning methods to business questions
Understanding of REST APIs and web services
Strong analytic mindset and logical thinking capability, strong QC mindset
The ability to explain complex solutions in a clear and easily understandable way.
Demonstrated consulting, creativity, critical thinking, project planning, and attention to detail capabilities
Great to have:
Experience with non-relational databases, graphs
Experience with building, testing, measuring, and deploying machine learning models in production
Experience deploying code into production through CI/CD tools
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration platforms
The Team
The Operational Effectiveness team at IQVIA is responsible for driving enterprise-wide initiatives focused on business process improvement, automation, future of work and more. The team is a constant source of innovation in a dynamic environment, with a focus on productivity, quality, costs savings, client delight, and strengthening our value proposition in the external marketplace.

As the profile and scope of the team expands, we require an additional full-time data scientist role with ideally experience with non-relational databases and machine learning models to work on company-wide, transformative projects. The role will report into the AI/ML team lead and will work with a global team.
Why Join?
Those who join us become part of a recognized global leader still willing to challenge the status quo to improve patient care. In RWS, you will have access to the most cutting-edge technology, the largest data sets, the best analytics tools and, in our opinion, some of the finest minds in the Healthcare industry.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted
IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com Junior Data Scientist

companyName: Andela - Third Party Job Board Only Postings
listing_jobDesc:
About Andela

Andela exists to connect brilliance and opportunity. Since 2014, we have been dedicated to breaking down global barriers and accelerating the future of work for both technologists and organizations around the world.

For technologists, Andela offers competitive long term career opportunities with leading organizations, access to a global community of professionals, and education opportunities with leading technology providers.

For companies, Andela provides access to a global network of fully integrated team members that unlock their business' innovation and growth potential.

At Andela, we are deeply passionate about creating long-lasting and transformative growth opportunities for all and doing it in an E.P.I.C. [andela.com/careers] way.

We are excited to continue building our remote first team with incredible people like you!
About the role

Andela's two-sided marketplace is a multifaceted hub of experienced talent and leading companies with exciting challenges related to pricing, matching, marketplace health, go-to-market campaigns and many others. Data Science is a key weapon at Andela to attack these problems. We employ a wide variety of approaches including but not limited to system dynamics and simulation, machine learning on both structured and unstructured data, recommendation algorithms, and combinatorial optimization. A Data Scientist at Andela will be involved in building ground breaking solutions often embedded in products serving both the marketplace and various business functions. You will be defining solution architecture, crafting the appropriate machine learning / optimization / experimentation model and guiding the execution of this model in collaboration with the Andela data, engineering and product teams.

Responsibilities:
Work with the Principal Data Scientist and other business partners to identify problem domains and corresponding data science approaches.
Develop the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) version of the solution.
Deploy the solution in production in collaboration with the data, engineering and product teams.
Requirements:
Graduate degree (MS/Ph.D.) in engineering/information systems / applied science or equivalent practical experience.
2-3 years work experience applying quantitative methods to business problems.
Flexibility in working with a variety of data science approaches.
Hands-on with coding, Python strongly preferred.
Nice-to-have: proficiency in mathematical modeling.

#LI-MV1
Benefits
Fully Remote work culture - we hire globally and all of our roles are fully remote!
Bring your own device stipend - buy your own laptop with funds from Andela
Quarterly work from home stipends
Flexible working hours
Equity (as a part of compensation package)
Healthcare, 401k / pension (US only)
Andela Affinity Groups
Growth & development paths
Generous Paid Time Off, Parental Leave, Compassionate Leave
And more to come! We're on a journey to reimagine global benefits at Andela

At Andela, we outcompete through diversity. We know that our strengths lie in the multiplicity of talents, perspectives, backgrounds & orientations resident in our community and we take pride in that. Andela is committed to a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. Each individual has the right to work in a professional atmosphere that promotes equal employment opportunities and prohibits discriminatory practices. Andela provides equal employment opportunities and workplace to all employees and applicants without regard to factors including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy (including breastfeeding), genetic information, HIV/AIDS or any other medical status, family or parental status, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Andela is home for all, come as you are. About Andela

Andela exists to connect brilliance and opportunity. Since 2014, we have been dedicated to breaking down global barriers and accelerating the future of work for both technologists and organizations around the world.

For technologists, Andela offers competitive long term career opportunities with leading organizations, access to a global community of professionals, and education opportunities with leading technology providers.

For companies, Andela provides access to a global network of fully integrated team members that unlock their business' innovation and growth potential.

At Andela, we are deeply passionate about creating long-lasting and transformative growth opportunities for all and doing it in an E.P.I.C. [andela.com/careers] way.

We are excited to continue building our remote first team with incredible people like you!
About the role

Andela's two-sided marketplace is a multifaceted hub of experienced talent and leading companies with exciting challenges related to pricing, matching, marketplace health, go-to-market campaigns and many others. Data Science is a key weapon at Andela to attack these problems. We employ a wide variety of approaches including but not limited to system dynamics and simulation, machine learning on both structured and unstructured data, recommendation algorithms, and combinatorial optimization. A Data Scientist at Andela will be involved in building ground breaking solutions often embedded in products serving both the marketplace and various business functions. You will be defining solution architecture, crafting the appropriate machine learning / optimization / experimentation model and guiding the execution of this model in collaboration with the Andela data, engineering and product teams.

Responsibilities:
Work with the Principal Data Scientist and other business partners to identify problem domains and corresponding data science approaches.
Develop the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) version of the solution.
Deploy the solution in production in collaboration with the data, engineering and product teams.
Requirements:
Graduate degree (MS/Ph.D.) in engineering/information systems / applied science or equivalent practical experience.
2-3 years work experience applying quantitative methods to business problems.
Flexibility in working with a variety of data science approaches.
Hands-on with coding, Python strongly preferred.
Nice-to-have: proficiency in mathematical modeling.

Scuderia AlphaTauri F1 Team is looking for driven and brilliant Data Scientist to join our Aerodynamic Technology team in Bicester. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on improving aero data collection, aero data processing and aero data correlation between wind tunnel, CFD and race track.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Areas that play to your strengths
All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
Expand all
Aerodynamic Data Collection
Refinement of measurement technologies
Mathematical optimisation of trajectories and data capture strategies to optimise the operating point within the Quality/Time/Coverage triangle
Developing systems for automated data capture and analysis
Aerodynamic Data Processing
Numerical analysis of measurement quality
Development of existing methodologies for processing force/moment, pressure, and flow field data sources
Specifying and implementing algorithms, including but not limited to ML and DL techniques, to analyse data captured with the goal of providing performance information to aerodynamicists
Mining of historical data to provide new insights and assist in defining development strategies both of tools and aero surfaces
Aerodynamic Data Correlation
Improve aero data correlation between tunnel, CFD and track by assisting development of interoperable APIs for data exchange
Aerodynamic Data Analysis
Developing, refining, and applying data analysis techniques across the domains to provide aerodynamicists with actionable information
Support of aerodynamic Data Lifecycle
Problem investigation, analysis, and rectification

EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
Minimum 2-year work experience in similar roles
Strong understanding of scientific programming languages such as Matlab, Python
Strong understanding of a modern object-oriented language such as C#/Java
Proficient with established computer/data science, machine learning, signal processing algorithms
Familiar with established robotics and motion planning paradigms
Capable of working to tight deadlines
Proactive development of detailed specifications based on business requirements
Excellent communication skills at both conceptual and technical levels
Natural problem-solving abilities
High degree of attention to detail
Experience in Motorsports is a plus
Computer/Data Science qualification or similar discipline to degree level
Fluency in English

Data Scientist – Mobile Gaming
Data Idols are working with a top-rated mobile gaming platform. Focussing on social gaming this organisation has built award-winning games connecting players from all over the world. Spanning various casino-style games they offer the thrill of the casino without the financial gambling aspect.
The Opportunity
This is an opportunity for a Data Scientist to work with the User Acquisition team to build time-series and machine learning models to help attract even more gamers and understand user behaviour. As a Data Scientist you will use statistical techniques to advise on budget allocation and the effectiveness of multiple marketing channels. You will also look at customer segmentation to improve user acquisition and user journey.
Skills and Experience
SQL
Python
Time-series
Customer segmentation
Excellent communication
What’s in it for you?
Up to £70,000
10% Bonus
Flexible working
If you’re a Data Scientist interested in the mobile gaming industry please send your cv in for further information

Senior Data Scientist (Commercial)
Locations: London, New York
Egencia is the world’s leading digital corporate travel platform. We are a trusted business travel partner that delivers the best technology and data driven experiences to help customers all around the world drive success in their business through business travel.
Data drives our business. Come join our Analytic team and take part in defining and distilling that data for key corporate decision makers and our clients around the world.
Position Summary
Egencia Analytics team is seeking a outstanding candidate for the role of Data Scientist III, an intelligent, results-oriented, passionate self-starters to join our global team. In this role, you will lead analytics projects end-to-end working with other passionate analysts in the team.
You will have the opportunity to work on a broad spectrum of areas which will include projects such as customer segmentation, recommendation engines, client lifetime value, anomaly detection and seeding your own ideas on what we work on next.
This is a technical role that requires an individual that can encourage, provide technical leadership and has a proven track record deploying models to production. You will be an outstanding Data Scientist with a wealth of experience and an abundance of ideas. We need you to be able to pick up new concepts quickly, understand the broader context in which a solution is deployed and deliver exceptional work at pace. Finally, this is an individual contributor role, but we will want you to mentor other team members, providing technical guidance and advice that will lead to better business outcomes and personal growth within the team.
What you will do
Passionate storytelling and articulation by bringing data to life!
Derive, interpret, and deliver results from diverse datasets and communicate meaningful insights to the business
Strong influence and relationship management skills; comfortable interacting across all levels of stakeholders.
Identify problem statements which can be solved using data science, machine learning and the automation of process.
Provide technical mentorship to other Data Scientists
Articulate solutions, methodologies and frameworks concisely to both technical and non-technical partners
Collaborate with technology and business leaders as appropriate to sustain momentum of delivery
What you will bring
Relevant Master's or PhD degree in any of the following fields: Machine Learning or computer science, statistics, mathematics with strong understanding of ML components.
Strong programming background and expertise in using SQL, Python
Advanced knowledge of Statistics
Proven excellence in leading and contributing to Data Science projects in a commercial setting
Able to perform in a fast-paced environment and be able to handle ambiguity.
Vocal with opinions and energized by new ideas
Keen to educate others
Excellent verbal and written communications.
What we will offer
Learning and development opportunity.
Mentoring program.
Flexible home working option.
Competitive benefits.
Diverse team that is globally based.
Why join Egencia?
Connections matter when it comes to business, and those connections start with our inclusive team of travel enthusiasts and technologists.
We thrive in a culture of curiosity - constantly reinventing for the future. It's the people that make Egencia special, so we want to make sure they’re happy. We do this by offering flexible work options, competitive benefits packages, learning and development opportunities as well as time to pursue them. And we always make sure we have fun along the way.
Our customers love working with us because we know satisfied customers start with a knowledgeable and enthusiastic team to support them. We trust each other to get great work and we encourage everyone to speak up, speak out, and be themselves.
Business travel is on the road to recovery. As part of the world’s largest corporate travel marketplace, we’re in a strong position to define the future as we lead the industry into a new era.
If this all sounds like something you’d like to jump on-board with, visit Egencia.com or check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.
Our commitment
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Egencia is wholly owned by American Express Global Business Travel (GBT). GBT is a joint venture that is not wholly owned by American Express Company or any of its subsidiaries (American Express). “American Express Global Business Travel”, “American Express", and the American Express logo are trademarks of American Express and are used under limited license. “American Express Meetings & Events” is a division of GBT.
Location
United Kingdom - London
It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.

GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement Senior Data Scientist (Commercial)
Locations: London, New York
Egencia is the world’s leading digital corporate travel platform. We are a trusted business travel partner that delivers the best technology and data driven experiences to help customers all around the world drive success in their business through business travel.
Data drives our business. Come join our Analytic team and take part in defining and distilling that data for key corporate decision makers and our clients around the world.
Position Summary
Egencia Analytics team is seeking a outstanding candidate for the role of Data Scientist III, an intelligent, results-oriented, passionate self-starters to join our global team. In this role, you will lead analytics projects end-to-end working with other passionate analysts in the team.
You will have the opportunity to work on a broad spectrum of areas which will include projects such as customer segmentation, recommendation engines, client lifetime value, anomaly detection and seeding your own ideas on what we work on next.
This is a technical role that requires an individual that can encourage, provide technical leadership and has a proven track record deploying models to production. You will be an outstanding Data Scientist with a wealth of experience and an abundance of ideas. We need you to be able to pick up new concepts quickly, understand the broader context in which a solution is deployed and deliver exceptional work at pace. Finally, this is an individual contributor role, but we will want you to mentor other team members, providing technical guidance and advice that will lead to better business outcomes and personal growth within the team.
What you will do
Passionate storytelling and articulation by bringing data to life!
Derive, interpret, and deliver results from diverse datasets and communicate meaningful insights to the business
Strong influence and relationship management skills; comfortable interacting across all levels of stakeholders.
Identify problem statements which can be solved using data science, machine learning and the automation of process.
Provide technical mentorship to other Data Scientists
Articulate solutions, methodologies and frameworks concisely to both technical and non-technical partners
Collaborate with technology and business leaders as appropriate to sustain momentum of delivery
What you will bring
Relevant Master's or PhD degree in any of the following fields: Machine Learning or computer science, statistics, mathematics with strong understanding of ML components.
Strong programming background and expertise in using SQL, Python
Advanced knowledge of Statistics
Proven excellence in leading and contributing to Data Science projects in a commercial setting
Able to perform in a fast-paced environment and be able to handle ambiguity.
Vocal with opinions and energized by new ideas
Keen to educate others
Excellent verbal and written communications.
What we will offer
Learning and development opportunity.
Mentoring program.
Flexible home working option.
Competitive benefits.
Diverse team that is globally based.
Why join Egencia?
Connections matter when it comes to business, and those connections start with our inclusive team of travel enthusiasts and technologists.
We thrive in a culture of curiosity - constantly reinventing for the future. It's the people that make Egencia special, so we want to make sure they’re happy. We do this by offering flexible work options, competitive benefits packages, learning and development opportunities as well as time to pursue them. And we always make sure we have fun along the way.
Our customers love working with us because we know satisfied customers start with a knowledgeable and enthusiastic team to support them. We trust each other to get great work and we encourage everyone to speak up, speak out, and be themselves.
Business travel is on the road to recovery. As part of the world’s largest corporate travel marketplace, we’re in a strong position to define the future as we lead the industry into a new era.
If this all sounds like something you’d like to jump on-board with, visit Egencia.com or check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.
Our commitment
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Job Overview
Data Scientist - product is required to join an AI Tech Unicorn landing and scaling a brand new team in London. This business is the foremost Computer Vision Scale up globally and pioneers in tools to power creatives to make visual content. They have won numerous prestigious global technology awards and have had 100’s of millions of downloads globally.

Job Description
The Role

This company has gained all of this success by putting data first and being a data-driven company meaning the data science department play a key role in decision making. This AI Tech unicorn are now looking for a senior and talented data scientist to join the team and work with an extremely talented product team to increase app performance and improve decision making.

You will do this by using ML and Statistical tools to build predictive and explanatory models to increase app performance affecting millions of users daily!

You Will –

Work with Several Stakeholders within the business to build data products using ML and Statistics
Design a roadmap for apps and use data science to guide product decisions.
Understand use of the platform to find growth opportunities

About you

As you –

You will have 4 years of experience as a data scientist in industry
2 + years delivering end to end machine learning projects from POC to Production
Experienced in Python
Experience in SQL
Advanced degree in a Quant field
Experience with deep learning and relevant tools

As a data scientist for this London AI scale up you can earn between £60k - £120k + a range of impressive benefits.


You will need to come to the office 3 days a week
Contact Details
To apply please email jake.kings@propellondon.com or apply via the website Job Overview

** MUST BE BASED IN EUROPE

An AI startup who operate a fully-remote team across Europe have a brand new vacancy for a Data Scientist with strong NLP skills to join the team as they enter their first stage of expansion. You will be the first of 3 new technical hires into the business so this is an exceptional opportunity to get in at the ground floor and establish yourself within the company.

Currently on the verge of closing a funding round, and led by some of the smartest minds in the industry, the company build AI SaaS products for the Engineering & Construction sectors that enable global businesses to reduce costs and minimise error on project work. You will be responsible for building NLP applications, training ML models and using your skills to bring innovation to the team and their products.

They’re ideally looking for someone who is up for a challenge, who isn’t afraid of a fast-paced working environment and who wants to be part of an early-stage startup.

Key skills:
** 3 Years’ experience in Data Science

** Desire to work in an early stage startup – future ambitions to grow a team etc.

** Machine Learning – building & training models

** Solid NLP skills – able to build NLP applications

** Analytics & BI

Package: £40-50K DOE + equity

This is obviously a very over-arching description of the role. For more detail on the specifics please get in touch today.

Data Scientist – Fully Remote Show more

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.

About this role
In this job, you’ll be accountable for using methodical Data science techniques to measure performance and influence change. You’ll be working closely with other teams in Digital, Commercial and Marketing to successfully apply and quantify these data techniques. You will mine and analyse big data sets using data science techniques, and deliver appropriate outcomes for the business, whether analysis, modelling and/or recommendations. You’ll be able to explain your output clearly to all levels of the business.
You'll have the following responsibilities
Use methodical Data science techniques to select and tune algorithms and quantify performance in a business relevant way
Tell engaging stories using non-technical language and exciting visualisations to influence change
Execute experiments to quantify the performance of algorithms in both digital and physical domains and test business hypotheses
Work with multiple stakeholders to understand the business problem and translate into deliverables.
Mine and analysis big data sets, leveraging data science skills and techniques to deliver business benefit.
You will work across a range of projects leveraging advanced techniques that include, but aren’t limited to predictive analytics from CRM, customer propensity modelling, audience segmentation, journey analytics, attribution, marketing and customer base campaign analytics.
Be able to put to use exploratory analysis methodologies to identify patterns and trends to use with the right statistical methods (clustering, PCA, regression, significance testing). You’ll also be happy in the world of machine learning, data mining and algorithm development to seek out new insight
You will feel confident extracting and manipulating data from our various data stores and storage framework and sources
Work with descriptive and predictive analytics (e.g. linear regression & propensity models, customer segmentation, data mining and trigger identification) of the mobile and converged customer base.
Support the business in optimising the use of predictive analytics and targeting across inbound and outbound contact strategies and all customer segments and brands.
Input into the data science strategy
You'll have the following skills & experience
AI approaches and techniques
Experience of using machine learning frameworks
Experience of predictive models
Background in analytics and statistics
Skills in Python and/or R, SQL
Programming skills
Hands on experience using big data technologies
It is expected to have;
Strategic thinking and planning; driving efficient ways of working and operating model
Making the difficult, simple to clearly communicate latest data and reports to all levels of the organisation.
High degree of expertise in data science technologies and ways of working
A clear understanding of the benefits of leveraging AI for business benefit
Advanced communications skills, being able to translate complex analysis into the language of business.
Benefits
At BT, we entertain, educate and empower millions of people every single day. We’re a brand built on connecting people – whether that’s friends, family, businesses or communities. Working here, you’ll receive an attractive salary and a range of competitive benefits, but – more than that – you’ll be joining an ambitious organisation with a culture of togetherness, collaboration and inclusivity, that takes a genuine and proactive interest in your progress and development. Benefits of working for BT include:
Discounted BT Broadband, TV & mobile packages and BT products
On target Bonus 10%
Share options and 10% pension contribution
Professional development
Flexible benefits/rewards including dental insurance, healthcare, gym memberships etc.
Well-being support for you and your family
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) and up to 3 days paid volunteering a year
Flexible and smart working (subject to business needs)
BT is an equal opportunities employer. We’re working hard to create an inclusive working environment, where people from all backgrounds can succeed. We want to make sure your recruitment experience is the best it can be – so, if you’re selected for an interview, please let us know if there’s any adjustments we can make that would be helpful for you.

About BT
BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT
How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application! Discounted BT Broadband, TV & mobile packages and BT products

Professional development

How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application! Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. About this role
In this job, you’ll be accountable for using methodical Data science techniques to measure performance and influence change. You’ll be working closely with other teams in Digital, Commercial and Marketing to successfully apply and quantify these data techniques. You will mine and analyse big data sets using data science techniques, and deliver appropriate outcomes for the business, whether analysis, modelling and/or recommendations. You’ll be able to explain your output clearly to all levels of the business.
You'll have the following responsibilities
Use methodical Data science techniques to select and tune algorithms and quantify performance in a business relevant way
Tell engaging stories using non-technical language and exciting visualisations to influence change
Execute experiments to quantify the performance of algorithms in both digital and physical domains and test business hypotheses
Work with multiple stakeholders to understand the business problem and translate into deliverables.
Mine and analysis big data sets, leveraging data science skills and techniques to deliver business benefit.
You will work across a range of projects leveraging advanced techniques that include, but aren’t limited to predictive analytics from CRM, customer propensity modelling, audience segmentation, journey analytics, attribution, marketing and customer base campaign analytics.
Be able to put to use exploratory analysis methodologies to identify patterns and trends to use with the right statistical methods (clustering, PCA, regression, significance testing). You’ll also be happy in the world of machine learning, data mining and algorithm development to seek out new insight
You will feel confident extracting and manipulating data from our various data stores and storage framework and sources
Work with descriptive and predictive analytics (e.g. linear regression & propensity models, customer segmentation, data mining and trigger identification) of the mobile and converged customer base.
Support the business in optimising the use of predictive analytics and targeting across inbound and outbound contact strategies and all customer segments and brands.
Input into the data science strategy
You'll have the following skills & experience
AI approaches and techniques
Experience of using machine learning frameworks
Experience of predictive models
Background in analytics and statistics
Skills in Python and/or R, SQL
Programming skills
Hands on experience using big data technologies
It is expected to have;
Strategic thinking and planning; driving efficient ways of working and operating model
Making the difficult, simple to clearly communicate latest data and reports to all levels of the organisation.
High degree of expertise in data science technologies and ways of working
A clear understanding of the benefits of leveraging AI for business benefit
Advanced communications skills, being able to translate complex analysis into the language of business.

About BT
BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT
How to Apply
It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application! Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.
There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us.
Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it.
Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for.

About this role
In this job, you’ll be accountable for using methodical Data science techniques to measure performance and influence change. You’ll be working closely with other teams in Digital, Commercial and Marketing to successfully apply and quantify these data techniques. You will mine and analyse big data sets using data science techniques, and deliver appropriate outcomes for the business, whether analysis, modelling and/or recommendations. You’ll be able to explain your output clearly to all levels of the business.
You'll have the following responsibilities
Use methodical Data science techniques to select and tune algorithms and quantify performance in a business relevant way
Tell engaging stories using non-technical language and exciting visualisations to influence change
Execute experiments to quantify the performance of algorithms in both digital and physical domains and test business hypotheses
Work with multiple stakeholders to understand the business problem and translate into deliverables.
Mine and analysis big data sets, leveraging data science skills and techniques to deliver business benefit.
You will work across a range of projects leveraging advanced techniques that include, but aren’t limited to predictive analytics from CRM, customer propensity modelling, audience segmentation, journey analytics, attribution, marketing and customer base campaign analytics.
Be able to put to use exploratory analysis methodologies to identify patterns and trends to use with the right statistical methods (clustering, PCA, regression, significance testing). You’ll also be happy in the world of machine learning, data mining and algorithm development to seek out new insight
You will feel confident extracting and manipulating data from our various data stores and storage framework and sources
Work with descriptive and predictive analytics (e.g. linear regression & propensity models, customer segmentation, data mining and trigger identification) of the mobile and converged customer base.
Support the business in optimising the use of predictive analytics and targeting across inbound and outbound contact strategies and all customer segments and brands.
Input into the data science strategy
You'll have the following skills & experience
AI approaches and techniques
Experience of using machine learning frameworks
Experience of predictive models
Background in analytics and statistics
Skills in Python and/or R, SQL
Programming skills
Hands on experience using big data technologies
It is expected to have;
Strategic thinking and planning; driving efficient ways of working and operating model
Making the difficult, simple to clearly communicate latest data and reports to all levels of the organisation.
High degree of expertise in data science technologies and ways of working
A clear understanding of the benefits of leveraging AI for business benefit
Advanced communications skills, being able to translate complex analysis into the language of business.

Data Science Graduate - Pebbles Financial Solutions LtdWho we are : Pebbles Financial Solutions is a boutique insurance consultancy, focusing on pricing and underwriting. We work with insurance providers in the UK and Europe to advise them on how to get the best out of their data, improve their analytical capability, and to advise on company strategy. Formed in 2021 by Dan Holland, the company launched as a vehicle for his advisory services, and Pebbles Financial Solutions swiftly secured deals with multiple clients. We have ambitious growth plans on the consultancy side, expanding our capacity and reaching into new markets.Whilst we are seasoned insurance professionals who have developed our skills and experience over decades of work in this industry, we believe that the main benefit we provide is in cutting through the complexity to produce clear and understandable practical solutions. We provide hands on recommendations that focus on technical implementation.Who we need: We are looking for someone who can work as a data scientist to develop predictive models and advisory products. These models will primarily be non-linear (GBMs), but we also require that you know how to build linear models and neural networks and that you can stand them up on a cloud server (GCP / AWS / Azure).You are likely to be working as an entry level analyst or data scientist in your first role or having just graduated from university. Your course training should be fresh in your mind, and you should be eager to begin a career in being able to use your skills to develop world class market leading models. However any level of experience is welcome to apply.Insurance is an arms race so beyond someone who is highly skilled in building models we need someone who is creative, diligent, persevering, and constantly challenges themselves to be better. You must also be able to listen to advice and to follow a plan because as a company we often have a high expectation from our clients and tight timescales.Knowledge of how to build an MLOps environment is an advantage but not essential.This role is fully remote so we need someone who is able to handle their time well without constant supervision or micromanagement.Development: This role will initially be a back-office role with client contact limited to consulting with technical peers from other companies on how to best use the models and products that we have created.Your career progression will see you develop into a consultant who will support the delivery of projects, and then a senior consultant who will design and lead solutions for our clients.Qualification requirements: Bachelors in a Data Science or computer science related degree (2:1 minimum).Masters degree desirable but not required, but should be in a related field.Main Responsibilities/Key duties: Building predictive models in python.Managing, cleaning, and enriching data.Feature engineering.Standing up models on cloud platforms and advising clients on how to do the same.Creating advisory products that our clients can use to enrich their data.R&D to ensure that we stay at the top of our competitors.Experience in the insurance industry is not a requirement at all.Why join us: Starting salary of £40k + bonus + dividend share, ensuring you are well rewarded.32 days holiday + public holidays, ensuring you work hard but are well rested.Work from home with equipment support provided.Wide diversity of interesting and cutting-edge work with no BAU.No heavy management structures, no micromanagement, no office politics.Private health care & death in service provided.Coursera membership for all employees to keep their skills fresh.Application deadline: 31/08/2022Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From £40,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Performance bonusYearly Fixed-term contract for 24 months, 40 hours per week (See Further Particulars section for more detail).


We offer an exciting opportunity for an ambitious graduate to manage a collaborative innovation partnership between The University of Warwick and SME Capital, a FinTech company that specialises in lending to the underserved market of Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs).


We are looking to recruit a recent graduate with a Masters or PhD in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or another quantitative subject, to undertake this 24-month project. The overall aim of this project is to apply expertise in data mining, machine learning, and data-driven modelling techniques to develop and commercialise a market leading technology product to improve the SME lending industry.


The position offers:

An exciting project that combines innovative multidisciplinary research and new techniques from data science and machine learning with an impactful commercial application.
Exposure to the London startup scene within a focused, experienced and motivated team.
The invaluable experience of independently managing a high-profile project.
Access to a budget of £4000 for professional development and training.
Mentoring and support from academic staff and industry professionals alike.


Based at SME Capital offices in central London, UK, the successful candidate will work directly with supervisors from both the University and SME Capital, and will use the facilities and resources of both organisations.


About KTP


This post is part of the Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) initiative funded by Innovate UK. Knowledge Transfer Partnerships is a UK-wide programme that has been helping businesses for the past 45 years to improve their competitiveness and productivity through the better use of knowledge, technology and skills that reside within the UK Knowledge Base. If you want to apply your degree and experience, start a “real job” straight away and gain a professional qualification, then a Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) is what you're looking for. For further information visit http://ktp.innovateuk.org/.


About SME Capital and The Academic Team


SME Capital: SME Capital is an established financial services provider that has maintained a strong differentiation through technology and data. SME Capital has experience building data products used by lenders & investors, and range from risk predictions (e.g., probability of default and time series forecasting) to data integration products.


The Academic Team: This is a project supported by an experienced academic team at the University of Warwick. The Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) will be supervised by Dr Martin Lotz and Dr Marya Bazzi, and be associated with the Mathematics Institute, one of the world’s leading research-focused Mathematics departments. The associate will have the opportunity to interact and collaborate with other members of staff and departments throughout the project.


Feel free to send any enquiries to Martin Lotz (Warwick) – martin.lotz@warwick.ac.uk, Marya Bazzi (Warwick) – marya.bazzi@warwick.ac.uk or Matthew Arderne (SME) – matthew.arderne@smecapital.com


Interview Date: TBC.
Job Description
JOB PURPOSE


Applications are invited for a Data Scientist with a Masters degree or PhD to start as soon as possible, with the overall aim of employing expertise in data mining, machine learning, and data-driven modelling techniques to develop and commercialise market leading technology in the SME lending industry. The position is fixed-term for 24 months, but there is a possibility for the project to develop into a longer-term collaboration. With that in mind, the post will provide access to resources for professional development and training.


The post is provided within the Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) framework, Europe’s leading programme helping businesses to improve their competitiveness and productivity through the better use of knowledge, technology and skills that reside within the UK knowledge base.



DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Throughout the KTP you will:

Work on an exciting project that combines innovative multidisciplinary research and new techniques from data science and machine learning with an impactful commercial application.

Be exposed to the London startup scene within a focused, experienced and motivated team.
Gain an invaluable experience of independently managing a high-profile project.

Have access to a budget of £4000 for professional development and training.

Be mentored and supported by academic staff and industry professionals.


The successful candidate will:

Liaise and collaborate with the relevant SME Capital staff and gain understanding of the commercial environment the company operates in.

Carry out research to identify, evaluate and solve problems relevant to the company:

Working with the academics to identify, study and utilise relevant literature;
Research solutions to a range of specific data problems;
Implement, test, and document algorithms for solving these problems.

Document research outputs and disseminate results both internally to SME Capital technology team and business stakeholders as well as externally through conference talks and publications.

Facilitate and actively engage with the commercialisation of the newly developed algorithms, with the goal to launch them as products:

Engage with potential new customers to understand market needs;
Iterate on the development of algorithms and supplementary technology to facilitate finding product-market fit;
With the support of the team, identify optimal options for route to market.

Manage the project independently, including running monthly project meetings, and liaising with the academic team.

Manage his/her own personal development plan with support from the advisors and make active use of the provided resources. Fixed-term contract for 24 months, 40 hours per week (See Further Particulars section for more detail).


We offer an exciting opportunity for an ambitious graduate to manage a collaborative innovation partnership between The University of Warwick and SME Capital, a FinTech company that specialises in lending to the underserved market of Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs).


We are looking to recruit a recent graduate with a Masters or PhD in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or another quantitative subject, to undertake this 24-month project. The overall aim of this project is to apply expertise in data mining, machine learning, and data-driven modelling techniques to develop and commercialise a market leading technology product to improve the SME lending industry.


The position offers:

An exciting project that combines innovative multidisciplinary research and new techniques from data science and machine learning with an impactful commercial application.
Exposure to the London startup scene within a focused, experienced and motivated team.
The invaluable experience of independently managing a high-profile project.
Access to a budget of £4000 for professional development and training.
Mentoring and support from academic staff and industry professionals alike.


Based at SME Capital offices in central London, UK, the successful candidate will work directly with supervisors from both the University and SME Capital, and will use the facilities and resources of both organisations.


About KTP


This post is part of the Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) initiative funded by Innovate UK. Knowledge Transfer Partnerships is a UK-wide programme that has been helping businesses for the past 45 years to improve their competitiveness and productivity through the better use of knowledge, technology and skills that reside within the UK Knowledge Base. If you want to apply your degree and experience, start a “real job” straight away and gain a professional qualification, then a Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) is what you're looking for. For further information visit http://ktp.innovateuk.org/.


About SME Capital and The Academic Team


SME Capital: SME Capital is an established financial services provider that has maintained a strong differentiation through technology and data. SME Capital has experience building data products used by lenders & investors, and range from risk predictions (e.g., probability of default and time series forecasting) to data integration products.


The Academic Team: This is a project supported by an experienced academic team at the University of Warwick. The Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) will be supervised by Dr Martin Lotz and Dr Marya Bazzi, and be associated with the Mathematics Institute, one of the world’s leading research-focused Mathematics departments. The associate will have the opportunity to interact and collaborate with other members of staff and departments throughout the project.


Feel free to send any enquiries to Martin Lotz (Warwick) – martin.lotz@warwick.ac.uk, Marya Bazzi (Warwick) – marya.bazzi@warwick.ac.uk or Matthew Arderne (SME) – matthew.arderne@smecapital.com

Summary
Innovative, uncompromising, romantic, provocative, upholding the power of emotion and the touch of the human hand: these are all elements that describe the fashion of the house of Alexander McQueen. The brand is synonymous with modern British couture, renowned for its strong identity and celebration of unbridled creativity. Integral to the McQueen culture is the juxtaposition between contrasting elements: femininity and masculinity, fragility and strength, tradition, and modernity. Under the creative direction of Sarah Burton, the house produces critically acclaimed collections, driven by unparalleled vision and respect for craftsmanship. Burton was made Head of Design for womenswear in 2000 and was appointed Creative Director in 2010. The luxury brand was founded by Lee Alexander McQueen in 1992. Among the greatest fashion designers of his time, the legacy of his work lives on.
Job Description
Alexander McQueen are currently looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join Alexander McQueen’s growing Decision Intelligence team at our head office in London.
Your opportunity?
The Junior Data Scientist will be working on several exciting projects, with the aim to build data-driven analysis & develop algorithms which will support Alexander McQueen with advanced machine learning approaches that significantly impact the daily operations of the business.
This is a great opportunity for someone with a keen interest in the fashion/retail industry and a passion for data science.
How you will contribute?
You will have the chance to get involved in setting up analytical tools, and deployment of ML models on different topics:
Operations: Optimization of the distribution leveraging on forecast methods and graph theory.
Communication: Support the Digital Marketing Strategy to better engage & understand our current audience.
Sales and Demand Forecasting.
Product/Client/Store Analysis.
Who you are?
Proficient Python developer (Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow)
Good understanding of ML/AI algorithms (Clustering, Classifier, Forecast)
Appetite for Graph Theory
Good knowledge in SQL
Experience using API
Experience and skills in DataViz/Data Analytics
Experience using GitHub
Understanding of Cloud Computing Environments & Qlik Sense would be a plus
Curious about technology and innovation
Interested in social media and digital strategy (FB API, WeChat,…)
Eager to learn, discover and develop skills
Hard worker and motivated
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Interest in Fashion
Why work with us?
This is a fantastic opportunity to become part of a dynamic team with a visionary brand that offers possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.
Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.
Job Type
Regular
Start Date
2022-08-26
Schedule
Full time
Organization

This is a fantastic opportunity to become part of a dynamic team with a visionary brand that offers possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.  
Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms – gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation – enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.

Data Scientist
Real-World Analytics & AI, RWS Technology
We are looking for a Data Scientist who is keen to build machine learning products at the cutting-edge of life sciences. The primary focus of the role is to develop ML algorithms and contribute to in-house libraries, for high scale-high complexity rich medical data to predict answers to healthcare challenges.
You will be working closely with software engineers, system architects and other data scientists to build automated and scalable routines / libraries, based on State-of-the-Art Machine Learning methodologies
The role also includes opportunities for Business Development, thought leadership, R&D, and academic dissemination.
At IQVIA we appreciate and nurture individual talent. Therefore, the exact blend of responsibilities and individual career development will in part depend on the skill set and aspirations of the successful candidate
Our ideal candidate: Experience
MSc or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Physics, Neuroscience, Mathematics or similar
Analytical experience within a top commercial or academic organisation where data-led problem solving was core part of the role.Experience with the design and delivery of advanced machine learning projects in commercial settings.
A proactive, innovative and pragmatic approach to problem solving and an ability to think critically and independently, able to work as part of a cross-functional team, and communicate clearly to provide insights based on research and analysis outputs.
Our ideal candidate: Tech Skills
Good knowledge of Machine Learning methods, applicable to tabular data, in particular gradient boosting classifiers (e.g. XGBoost, LightGBM)
Experience with explainability methods (e.g. SHAP)
Good programming skills in Python
Experience of the data science package landscape (for example numpy, pandas, matplotlib, etc)
Understanding of what it takes to write clean code
Experience with software development lifecycle.
Bonus points for:
Experience in probabilistic modelling or causal inference
Experience with standard statistical analysis techniquesGood knowledge of deep learning methods
Experience with healthcare data (e.g. patient-level, longitudinal data)
Knowledge of epidemiology / biostatistics, particularly analytical issues relating to studies of treatment effectiveness, disease progression, adherence, healthcare utilization, etc.
The Team
Our Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence team within the RWA & AI Solutions Technology division is a fast-growing group of collaboratives, enthusiastic, and entrepreneurial individuals. In our never-ending quest for opportunities to harness the value of Real-World Analytics, we are at the centre of IQVIA’s advances in areas such as machine learning and cutting-edge statistical approaches. Our efforts improve retrospective clinical studies, under-diagnosis of rare diseases, personalized treatment response profiles, disease progression predictions, and clinical decision-support tools.

You will join this high-profile team to work on a wide range of ground-breaking problems in health outcomes across disease areas including Oncology, Neurology, Chronic diseases such as diabetes, and a variety of very rare conditions. The Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence Analytics teamwork together with statisticians, epidemiologists and disease area experts across the wider global team, leveraging a vast variety of anonymous patient-level information from sources such as electronic health records.
Why Join?

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Job Overview
A product led HealthTech start up the is utilizing AI and ML to deliver a platform that provides a social good to millions of patients a year is Looking for a NLP Data Scientist to join a brand new team. Working with industry experts you will use your NLP Knowledge and skills to improve the NLP capabilities of the platform.

Implementing your skills in named entity recognition, topic analysis and Sentiment analysis you will derive insights from Social Media Data. You will have a knowledge software engineering best practices and have experience of taking products from inception to release. But don’t worry – you will have an engineering team that will be able to support you here also. This is a fully remote opportunity and you should be comfortable working in Distributed teams
Job Description
About You

You will be Naturally motivated to work in a start up environment.
You will be able to identify the best opportunities for named entity recognition, topic analysis and sentiment analysis on large volumes of social media data.You will have experience of software engineering best practices and cloud computingYou will have 5 years’ experience in NLP across Academia and commercially with at least 3 years commercially.
Contact Details
Please Contact Jake.Kings@propellondon.com Job Overview

We are searching for a talented data scientist to assist in developing statistical models, particularly machine learning models, to improve healthcare outcomes for people with epilepsy in low- to middle-income countries. The Epilepsy Pathway Innovation in Africa (EPInA project is a large NIHR multinational study that aims to improve the lives of people with epilepsy within Africa and beyond. Leveraging from this, the Oxford Martin Programme on Global Epilepsy aims to develop mHealth technologies to help in the diagnosis, management and education of people with epilepsy and their local communities. We will be working in Africa (Kenya, South Africa, Zimbabwe) as well as in Brazil and India with the possibility to expand to other regions.

Using our routinely updated and expanding datasets from these regions, we are developing mathematical models that will be implemented into mHealth-based clinical tools to assist healthcare workers in improving the diagnosis and treatment of people with epilepsy. Our work is grounded in region- and culture-specific research and encompasses collaborations from a broad range of disciplines, including clinical medicine, basic science, engineering, software development, history and anthropology. This role is likely to include travel to host regions (COVID-dependent) enabling working within local communities to develop, implement, refine and validate these models.

You will have a degree in a relevant subject and a post-graduate degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computing, or a related subject, and you will also have demonstrable experience, ability and practical success in data science, including independent ability to develop machine learning models. It is also essential to have demonstrable ability to organise and prioritise work efficiently whilst delivering results to the required standard and to an agreed schedule. Previous experience in developing machine learning models for clinical applications is a desirable.

The post is full time for a fixed term until 31st October 2023 in the first instance.
Only applications received before 12.00 midday on 09.08.2022 will be considered.
Interviews will be held as soon as possible thereafter.
